alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 3:30AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Wheeler and Montgomery Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.3 feet, Bankfull conditions occur along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EDT Monday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening and continue rising to a crest of 18.8 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 02/09/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
